intro: Strophis cirrhosa, commonly known as the curly-stemmed strophis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, curling stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and appear in the axils of the leaves. Strophis cirrhosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
